visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing quarterly regional revenue distribution using clustered columns with accessibility-enhanced formatting
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 3 dimensions: quarter (categorical ordinal), region (nominal categorical), and revenue (continuous numerical). Synthetic data was generated with μ=12.4M (σ=3.8M) for North America showing 50% annual growth, μ=10.2M (σ=1.1M) for Europe with seasonal stability, and μ=9.8M (σ=3.0M) for Asia-Pacific demonstrating exponential growth. The column chart was chosen to enable direct comparison between discrete temporal intervals and categorical groups, maximizing data-ink ratio through clean gridlines and value-based label filtering. Cairo's principles are applied through pre-attentive color coding (distinct hue separation) and proportional encoding (column heights). Accessibility is maintained through semantic HTML structure and screen reader-optimized metadata. Statistical anchors include Q4 Asia-Pacific showing 106% growth from Q1, while Europe maintains ±8% variance throughout the fiscal year.
